ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.


ä¸æ˜¯äººä»¬æŠ›å¼ƒäº†å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ã€‚è€Œæ˜¯å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ä¸ä¼šæ˜¯ç©å®¶çš„è‹±é›„äº†ã€‚å†ä¹Ÿä¸ä¼šæ˜¯äº†ã€‚It's not that people abandoned Overwatch. It's that Overwatch won't be the player's hero anymore. Not Anymore.

still waiting to play a balanced match months after release of this shithole

Been a player since Overwatch released and I'm just here to leave my negative review because there finally is a way for me to voice my dissatisfaction with the absolute disappointment and mess that Blizzard made of Overwatch.

I have never seen a developer not just ruin their reputation, but entirely fumble one of the best Multiplayer games to release in the last years this hard.

Overwatch 2 is a complete downgrade of Overwatch 1 in almost every way:
- Everything is locked behind a Battlepass with the design being based on FOMO so that you buy into it.
- No more lootboxes, all of your lootboxes get/got opened and the only way to get anything in the game now is from the Battlepass tracks, or to grind for the near-useless ingame currency that takes you 100 hours of play to even unlock a basic skin.
- Matches have been changes from the classic 6v6 to 5v5 and cut one tank from each Team, making the game a lot more boring

And there are plenty more issues that I haven't bothered to type here and/or document because I'm quite honestly just done with Overwatch as a whole. I'll probably play a few hours on the Steam Version just to see of the changes made since the Overwatch 2's """launch""" but I doubt my mind will be changed much. If at all.

ã‚ã¨blizzardã¯ã‚¦ã‚£ãƒ‰ã‚¦ã¨ãƒãƒ³ã‚¾ãƒ¼ã¨ã‚½ãƒ³ãƒ–ãƒ©ã‚’æ¶ˆã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚
Imagine getting toxic to a beginner in unranked match

Spring/Summer 2016, Overwatch (1) releases and I'm having a blast. It's a fun game, gameplay instantly ticks the boxes, easy to learn hard to master as usual with Blizzard. 

Sure, there are some loot boxes but it's only cosmetics & not very invasive. Then Blizzard, in all its greediness, realised they were sitting on an unexploited cash mountain.

Ensues the scrapping of OW1, the [b][u]promise[/u][/b] of a full PvE mode and a 2.0 game.

7 years later, OW2 is a shoddy game as a service, lacking updates, lacking features, lacking the promised PvE mode, lacking fun. You know what's not lacking? In-app purchases, battlepass, gated heroes, cash shop, [b]greed[/b].

It's now been several years and Blizzard's soul is dead. They sell predatory products under the guise of nostalgia and big IPs. I'm happy to finally see their games outside of their Battlenet ecosystem so we can truly see how the players feel about them.
Rule 34 is more interesting than the gameplay itself.
